Small businesses drive the Canadian economy – they create middle class jobs, support our communities & make them even better places to call home. Today, we are keeping a promise we made to Canadians in 2015. Beginning January 1st, we intend to lower the small business tax rate from 10.5% to 10%. We’ll lower it even further starting in 2019 – bringing it down to 9%. #promisekept

Les petites entreprises font rouler l’économie canadienne – elles créent des emplois pour la classe moyenne, soutiennent nos communautés et y rendent la vie plus agréable. Aujourd’hui, nous tenons une promesse que nous avons faite aux Canadiens en 2015. À compter du 1er janvier, nous ramenons le taux d’imposition des petites entreprises de 10,5 % à 10 %. Nous le réduirons encore à compter de 2019 – à 9 %. #promessetenue
Cruiseable helps people discover, plan and book great cruise vacations in a simpler, more fun way than any other solution. Now available in the App Store as well as on the Cruiseable.com website.

Socialbrite.org is a social enterprise that offers nonprofits and social change organizations:• strategic advice and planning for use of social media• a deep social media learning center• social media tools training through workshops and bootcampsJD has handed over responsibility for the consultancy to his partners.

October 22, 2012, Jessica was a client of JD’S

JD Lasica is among the leading thinkers in the field of social marketing for nonprofits.  He has written extensively on the subject and is one to the "go to" resources for leaders in the field.  He's an excellent public speaker / trainer and can be relied upon to deliver great advice and practical information to session participants.  JD offered a pre-session social media bootcamp at the National Conference on Volunteering and Service and we were oversold.  The revues were fantastic.  I highly recommend JD!

Tamara Schweitzer Raben
Nonprofit Communications and Knowledge Management
January 12, 2012, Tamara reported directly to JD

JD is a whiz at what he does and a fountain of knowledge on all things social media and technology-related. Even though I worked remotely as the editor of Socialbrite, and JD and I operated from separate sides of the country, JD was always accessible and made himself available at all hours of the day. He was always gracious about sharing his expertise, and gave me a great deal of autonomy over the editorial management of Socialbrite. In his capacity as a social media strategist for the nonprofit community, he has such passion and dedication for his clients, and is a respected leader and instructor. He is a tireless worker -- he never lets anything slip through the cracks, and he has an amazing ability to juggle an endless amount of demands. JD has been (and will continue to be) an invaluable mentor to me in my endeavors as an online media professional and social change advocate.

Reverend Deborah Alvarez-Rodriguez at Jones Memorial Methodist Church
January 5, 2012, Deborah was a client of JD’S

I have had the pleasure of working and learning from JD for the past year.  His expertise, creativity and collaborative styling of working having yielded some major advancements in Goodwill Industries of San Francisco's social media platform, strategies and impact.  Our new website is far more impactful and the analytics on views and usage are excellent.  We experienced our highest return in online giving in 2011.  Our overall social media plan is well into implementation with outstanding results.  On a personal note, JD's mentoring of me and my executive and senior teams has resulted in building a new network of colleagues, collaborators, and partners committed to advancing our mission.  Finally, JD is great fun to work with and I highly recommend him.  Debbie Alvarez-RodriguezPresident & CEOGoodwill Industries of San Francisco, San Mateo and Marin

CEO at MobileNet Technology
January 12, 2011, JD worked with Michael in the same group

I have worked with JD Lasica for some time now. We worked to get JD to join us to help with a major project that needed an expert in all aspects of social media. We thought JD was our guy and as he began his work and it unfolded further, all our expectations were confirmed. JD is the consumate professional, knows his field inside and out, meets or exceeds the goals he sets for himself and works tirelessly often working late into the night to meet deadlines. JD does an excellent job of communicating and in fact introduced us to several tools we could use among our group to communicate better and more easily. Our team has very much enjoyed JD's constantly positive attitude in often long hours of work. He accomplished a good deal of progress during our project.

Marc Smolowitz
Multi-Award Winning Director, Producer, Executive Producer w/25+ yrs of experience across the entertainment business
December 28, 2010, JD worked with Marc in the same group

JD Lasica and I worked together directly as consultants to the New Media Lab & Incubator, a unique project of the Renaissance Journalism Center at San Francisco State University. The project involved a team of new media & social media producers working with 5 national nonprofits on special projects designed to unleash their journalistic, story telling and fund raising capacities. The project as a whole lasted one year, and it was a great success -- largely in part to JD's vision, leadership, and generosity of ideas & spirit. JD is a thought leader for our generation in many areas, a kind of a socially responsible technology guru who many of us look up to with high regard. To work around him in an incubator setting where we could collaborate and focus on innovation, strategy and new ideas was an honor. I learned a great deal from him, and I know others on this project also greatly benefited by his presence and contributions. I look forward to the chance to work with JD again. He is an amazing colleague!

A pioneer in reporting on the transforming media landscape, JD came up with the idea of a distributed network of social media thought leaders to serve the needs of the non-profit space. Through his considerable personal connections and design/programming/editorial skills, he built a leading portal of timely information and evergreen resources for social good. Dig around the site and be amazed. (http://www.socialbrite.org)  JD's style is one of identifying areas of opportunity to incorporate social strategy, then pulling in trusted colleagues for collaboration to address the client’s challenges. It's been fun and energizing to be part of such a team of seasoned experts!

summary: JD is widely considered one of the world's leading authorities on the changing media landscape. He is an entrepreneur, author, strategist, journalist and public speaker — and spoke at the United Nations in 2012 on how to use social media to combat global poverty. He is co-founder of Cruiseable, a startup focused on creating a better cruise experience. He founded Socialbrite.org, a social media learning hub and consultancy serving nonprofits, including SF Goodwill, Twin Cities Habitat for Humanity, Scholastic and Cal Humanities. He also founded Socialmedia.biz, a company offering social media solutions to businesses that want to use social media and social strategies to build customer relationships. JD was co-founder of Ourmedia.org, the first free video hosting and sharing site (launched in March 2005, six weeks before YouTube). His 2005 book "Darknet"​ (Wiley & Sons), which coined the term "personal media revolution,"​ explored the emerging media landscape. He has been named one of Silicon Valley's top 40 influencers, one of the top 100 influencers in social media, one of CNET's Top 100 Media Bloggers and one of the OnMobile Power Press100 (2013). And heck, look at the url: He's LinkedIn member #1498 (the # is no longer visible after 467 million).JD was a member of senior management in four tech startups - Sidewalk, Babycenter, Ivendor and MediaMobz - and participated in three Aspen Institute roundtables on civic engagement, mobile technologies and cloud computing.Specialties: • Entrepreneurship, startups• Social media  • Social media marketing• Business Strategy• Strategic Planning• Internet Marketing• Emerging media/user-generated content• Participatory journalism and the future of media
name: JD Lasica
title: Entrepreneur, author, tech innovator, journalist, social media strategist, change agent
